column4: My resolution always resets after reboot. Running nvidia. Help please?
what card, what version of ubuntu, what driver ?
did it work ok with the nouveau driver ?
why not sticking with it then ?
No HW acceleration, without it, you can't call it computer
unless you want to play games with your 8600, you don't need the proprietary driver tbh
I am getting edid error in xorg.0.log. I tried to bypass the with loads of options, but I always get one about DPI, after that, it sets the refresh rate to 60
I don't want to play games, hd movies
the open source driver runs very fine for old hardware, Nvidia does not care about your old 8600 on the other end...
there's a small section on this problem here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia, have you tired it ?
The G81 cards are supported, even the 6k series.
what about the link to the ubuntu documentation ?
thanks, but my answer is not there. Searched the web like crazy, There's no solution for VGA, I guess

it's weird, I've got a similar machine at work and the only thing I did was to use nvidia-settings to set-up my resolution on mu dual-monitor config, save it to a new /etc/X11/xorg.conf and that was it
not sure if VGA or DVI :S
no solution proposed on this page
